metadata.title: Tuesday, 30th September, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when construction of Limulunga-Mushitwambumu road to link Mongu to Lukulu via Mbanga will commence;
(b)    whether a contractor for the project has already been identified; and
(c)    what the cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    who owns the S S Liemba Water Vessel which operates on Lake Tanganyika;
(b)    whether the Government has any shares in the Company that owns the Vessel; and
(c)    when the Government will procure a bigger and modern vessel to provide water transport to the people of Nsumbu and Mpulungu on the Lake.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    which contractor is working on the road from the Great East Road in Chelstone area via Kamanga Compound to Kabangwe on the Great North Road;
(b)    what the contract sum for the project is;
(c)    what the completion period is; and
(d)    what the scope of works being done is.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    what the total number of workers employed directly by Konkola Copper Mines (KCM) Plc is;
(b)    whether KCM Plc sells copper to Vendata Resources Plc;
(c)    if so, how much copper was sold in 2012; and
(d)    how much money was paid by KCM Plc, in form of taxes, to the Zambia Revenue Authority in 2012.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Government will build bridges in Lukashya Parliamentary Constituency across the following rivers
parts: (a)    Lukulu, to connect Lualuo to Mukanga Wards;
(b)    Lualuo, to connect Lualuo to Chumba Wards; and
(c)    Lualuo, to connect Lualuo to Chibundu Wards.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development when the following basic schools in Mwandi Parliamentary Constituency will benefit from the rural electrification programme
parts: (a)    Mabumbu;
(b)    Loanja; and
(c)    Sankolonga.
(a)    when Nkeyema Health Centre in Nkeyema District will be upgraded to a district hospital; and
(b)    when an ambulance will be provided to the Health Centre.
(a)    when the Zambia News and Information Services (ZANIS) office in Kaputa District will be provided with the following:
(i)    video cameras and other related equipment; and (ii)    motor vehicle; and
(b)    why a driver was deployed to the District without a motor vehicle.
(a)    why construction of the resource centre in Kalabo District has stalled;
(b)    what the total cost of the project is;
(c)    how much money has so far been disbursed;
(d)    when the project is expected to be completed; and
(e)    what the name of the contractor working on the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands, Environment and Natural Resources
parts: (a)    when the tree planting project by the Zambia Forests and Forestry Industries Corporation (ZAFFICO) in Kawambwa District will commence;
(b)    what the cost of the project is;
(c)    how many hectares of land have been allocated to ZAFFICO for the project; and
(d)    how many jobs will be created by the project.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of a classroom block at Kaale Primary School in Sesheke Parliamentary Constituency will be completed; and
(b)    what has delayed the completion of the project.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when the Social Cash Transfer Programme will be extended to the following parts of Bwacha Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Makululu;
(b)    Makupu;
(c)    Munga;
(d)    Munyama;
(e)    Kang’omba;
(f)    Kalwelwe; and
(g)    Kalonga farming area (near Mukobeko Maximum Prison).

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of a university in Katete District will commence;
(b)    whether a contractor has already been identified and, if so, what the name of the contractor is;
(c)    what the time-frame for undertaking the project is; and
(d)    where the site of the university is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the rehabilitation of Nchelenge Secondary School will be undertaken;
(b)    whether an audit of the K1,000,000 that was spent on the partial rehabilitation of the School has already been undertaken; and
(c)    if so, what the findings are.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the implementation of the Pave Zambia Project will commence in Kwacha Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    how many kilometres of township roads will be paved;
(c)    what the total cost of the project is; and
(d)    how many jobs will be created as a result of the project. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (23rd September)        -       Resumption of Debate.
